page.title: 03FARM LAND,STRETTON-ON-DUN.
page.content: THE FIELDS AROUND STRETTON ON DUNSMORE ARE MAINLY{CROPS. RAPE}IS THE MOST COMMON CROP, WITH SOME{WHEAT}AND A LITTLE{HAY.}THE ARE ALSO SEVERAL FIELDS OF GRASS. THE FARM UP RUGBY LANE DOES NOT HAVE A NAME AS IT IS ONLY A{SMALLHOLDING.}IT HAS NINE ACRES WHICH ARE USED MAINLY FOR GRAZING. {MOOR FARM}AT BROOKSIDE HAS ONE HUNDRED AND TEN ACRES,WHICH GROW WHEAT, BARLEY, OATS AND GRASS. MR. SIMPSON, WHO OWNS IT HAS LOTS OF FIELDS SPREAD AROUND BUT THE CROPS WHICH HE GROWS ARE FOR USE ON HIS OWN FARM. MR. SIMPSON HAS{SHEEP AND BEEF CATTLE.}HE GRAZES THE CATTLE ON HIS OWN LANDS AND FEEDS THEM ON CONCENTRATES TO HELP FATTEN THEM UP. HE DOES NOT BELIEVE IN INJECTING THEM OR USING ANY OTHER UNNATURAL METHOD FOR FATTENING. HE USES THE SHEEP FOR MEAT AND BREEDING.
